channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KY

item.title: Report X-2023061327
item.description:
Report X-2023061327

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-23
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A LEAKING AIR PACKAGE THAT WAS MARKED UN1044 FIRE EXTINGUISHERS WITH A NON-FLAMMABLE GAS DIAMOND LABEL AND GROUND LTD QTY MARKING. UPON INSPECTION OF THE INNER CONTENTS DISCOVERED ONE VICTORY FIRE AND GAS WATER FIRE EXTINGUISHER, 2.5GAL. THE SAFETY PIN WAS NOT IN PLACE. THE FIRE EXTINGUISHER DISCHARGED FROM THE NOZZLE. PRIOR TO DISCOVERY THE PACKAGE WAS GROUND TRAILERED TO SDF. THE PACKAGE WAS SCANNED INTO AN AIR CONTAINER AT SDF BUT WAS NOT FLOWN.

item.title: Report X-2023060919

Report X-2023060919

  • City: INDEPENDENCE

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The manager noticed the wet hazmat package, they called QA. We cleaned up the spilled product with absorbent pads. We secured the package and soiled clean up materials in a lined red tote. DescribePack: Cap became loose DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a lined red tote and cap was tightened

DescribePack: Entire glass bottle was shattered during handling causing all contents to leak out into box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was put into a lined tote.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE QA STATION AND UPON INSPECTION IT WAS FOUND THAT THE LITERS OF FORMICAL 4 HAD BEGUN TO LEAK DUE TO SOME HAVING LOOSE CAPS WHICH MAY HAVE BEEN CAUSE BY THE LACK OF PROTECTION FOR THE CONTENTS. DescribePack: LOOSE CAPS DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A HAZMAT BAG WHICH WAS THEN PLACED IN A HAZMAT DRUM.

item.title: Report X-2023060065
item.description:
Report X-2023060065

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-02
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: UPON INSPECTION OF TWO WET BOXES, RESPONDER DISCOVERED THESE TO BE UNDECLARED DRY ICE PACKAGES WITH CONDENSATION FORMING ON THE OUTSIDE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE INNER CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY FIVE POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING PLANT BASED BURGERS. INNER FLAPS OF THE BOXES HAVE A RED STICKER MARKED PLANTA, CAUTION - DRY ICE - AVOID CONTACT WITH SKIN AND EYES. THESE MARKINGS WERE FOLDED INCORRECTLY SO THEY WERE ONLY VISIBLE WHEN THE BOXES WERE OPENED. THERE WERE NO VISIBLE DRY ICE MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES. THERE ARE VISIBLE RED STICKERS STATING PLANTA PERISHABLE AND REFRIGERATE UPON ARRIVAL. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBER TO ANOTHER CONSIGNEE IN THE USA IS 1Z25E9F10193762614.

item.description:

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package came off of a trailer with leaking stains along the corner of the packaging. Package was isolated and placed in a Hazmat drum where inspection revealed that one of the gallon jugs inside had a loose cap that caused the internal leak. DescribePack: Loose cap/seal on the jug DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Wrap and seal the caps in an outer layer of plastic

item.title: Report E-2023060018
item.description:
Report E-2023060018

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-12
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 12, 2023, one (1) 300-gallon tote of hypochlorite solution had a supplier error and released approximately five (5) ounces of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted surfaces. FCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the solution and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023060049
item.description:
Report X-2023060049

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-27
  • City: WALTON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE HAZMAT AUDITORS CALLED AND SAID THEY HAD A LEAKING HAZMAT. UPON ARRIVAL IT WAS AN OXIDIZER/CORROSIVE LABELED HAZMAT THAT WAS OXYGEN BLEACH. RESPONDER FOLLOWED THE OXIDIZER RESPONSE SHEET, PUT ON PPE AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL. RESPONDER TOOK IT BACK TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. RESPONDER SOLIDIFIED ALL 1.5 GALLONS USING SODIUM BICARBONATE AS ITS PH WAS 2. RESPONDER BAGGED IT INTO GREEN BAGS AND BEGAN TO ENTER IT INTO ETT. RESPONDER FOLLOWED COC AND CONTACTED BASE AND ENVIORMENTAL COORDINATOR WHO CALLED AN OUTSIDE RESPONDER TO THE SCENE. ONCE THEY ARRIVED, THEY CLEANED IT UP AND PUT IT IN A 55-GAL PLASTIC DRUM.

DescribePack: There was staining on the outside of the box. Upon being opened, the bottle with an open lid was visible. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The item was placed in a spill tote in order to prevent further leakage.

We secured the soiled cleanup materials and package in a lined red tote. ` DescribePack: Cap became loose DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Caps were tightened and placed in a lined red tote.

item.title: Report X-2023051116
item.description:
Report X-2023051116

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-17
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The caps on three of the cans came loose and an internal leakage resulted. The package was a part of a HazMat shipment dropped off to QA; and once it was brought to QA, it was set aside so that it could be worked on. DescribePack: The caps on three of the cans were loose and staining was visible on both the inside and outside of the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The item was separated from the rest of the HazMats and was tended to once the others were processed.

item.title: Report X-2023050789

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found on a dock walk in a red tote with signs it was already leaking previously. QA was called and it was picked up. Nothing to clean up. DescribePack: Cap on jerrican inside package was loose and leaking. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was kept up right to prevent further leakage since lid could not be tightened.

  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO PD 1 FOR A CORROSIVE HAZMAT LEAKER. UPON ARRIVAL RESPONDER SAW THE PACKAGE ON THE FLOOR WITH LIQUID AROUND IT, RESPONDER PROCEEDED TO FOLLOW THE CORROSIVE RESPONSE SHEET AND USED PPE. RESPONDER PUT SODIUM DOWN AND CONTAINERIZED THE BOX IN A SPILL TRAY. THE HAZMAT PAPERS NOTED IT WAS SULPHURIC ACID.

QA was called to pick it up, drum was put into a lined tote and a spill pad was used to clean up the ring that the leaked product left on dock floor. DescribePack: Small .5 inch gouge/cut in lower part of side of drum was found to be leaking. Unsure how gouge/cut happened. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Drum was put into a lined tote.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found leaking on dock, outer package shows signs of being dropped, package was put into a lined tote and spill pads were used to clean up leaked product. DescribePack: Cap on top of metal bottle was broken off during handling causing entire contents of bottle to leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was put into a lined tote and kept in an upright position to prevent further leakage.

item.title: Report X-2023050398
item.description:
Report X-2023050398

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-07
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KY A HAZARDOUS MATERIALS PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED LEAKING. UPON INSPECTION THE INNER CONTENTS WE FOUND ONE LITER BOTTLE OF TRUE TERPENES CDT GRENADINE THAT HAD A CRACKED CLOSURE. THE LEAK WAS CONTAINED WITHIN THE INNER PACKAGING BUT HAD BEGUN TO SOIL THE OUTER BOX. THE PACKAGE HAD SUCCESSFULLY PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT AT THE ORIGIN FACILITY PRIOR TO DISCOVERY.

item.title: Report E-2023050049
item.description:
Report E-2023050049

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-01
  • City: WILLIAMSBURG
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 1, 2023, at 1650 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Williamsburg, Kentucky regarding the release of approximately 2 gallons of Acrylic Resin Solution (Resin solution, UN1866, 3, III) from (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The release was reportedly due to a puncture to the drum and was contained to a 5’ x 1’ area of the trailer floor. No drains or waterways were affected by the release. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release using absorbents, hand tools and the proper PPE. All waste debris generated was containerized in (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The waste drum was then transported offsite by contractors for proper disposal.
